abstract: Ginia Bellafante Big City column on Brooklyn Navy Yard, which once was oldest continually active industrial plant in New York State and is now a draw for artists and filmmakers; notes coalition of union interests and sustainable-living advocates have called for large-scale initiative to expand transit manufacturing in state and city by capitalizing on yard's history.
snippet: Why couldn’t our brake parts and headlights and signal equipment, even our rail cars and buses, be made in New York once again?
lead_paragraph: Why couldn’t our brake parts and headlights and signal equipment, even our rail cars and buses, be made in New York once again?

headline.main: One Day, Maybe, Artisanal Train Cars
headline.print_headline: One Day, Maybe, Artisanal Train Cars
headline.seo: A Push to Return Transit Manufacturing to New York
